event.logging.impl

Class DefaultEventLoggingService

  • java.lang.Object
    • event.logging.impl.DefaultEventLoggingService
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    EventLoggingService

    public class DefaultEventLoggingService
extends java.lang.Object
implements EventLoggingService
    This is the default implementation for creating an event that writes to Log4J when logged.

      • loggedWorkBuilder

        public EventLoggerBuilder.TypeIdStep loggedWorkBuilder()
        Description copied from interface: EventLoggingService
        Creates a builder to assist with logging an event for a Runnable or Supplier. This method allows for a piece of work to be run and logged in one go with any exceptions being logged appropriately. By default if an exception is throw in the logged work then a failure outcome will be added to the
        Specified by:
        loggedWorkBuilder in interface EventLoggingService
        Returns:
        A builder instance.

      • setValidate

        public void setValidate(java.lang.Boolean validate)
        Set to true if the event logging service should validate the output XML against the schema. This option helps identify areas of code that are producing invalid data. For performance reasons it is recommended that validation is not performed in production.

        If validate is set to null then the system property shall be used to determine if validation is performed.

        Specified by:
        setValidate in interface EventLoggingService
        Parameters:
        validate - The validation flag.

      • isValidate

        public boolean isValidate()
        Use to determine if the event logging service is set to validate data against the XML schema.
        Specified by:
        isValidate in interface EventLoggingService
        Returns:
        True if the validate flag is set.
